fields.description:
Hi,

As requested by the project leade, I have hidden the reporter field in one of our project DBs in order to hide the submitters identification. But now we need this information to clarify who submitted which issue, so I have unhidden this field in the project's field configuration scheme and created an excel. But now all the users are listed as "anonymous" in the reporter field.

How can I clarify these "anonymous" users in the "Reporter" field.
fields.summary: Indentifiy the anonymous users defined in hidden "Reporter" field"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36046].
  {panel}

It would be great, and easy to implement, and rest function that could be used by jira-administrators to run SQL queries (SELECTs) directly on jira database.

This could be used to gather data from JIRA database in many use-cases where current REST api does not support it.

Considering that this is read-only and that the JIRA database structure is quite stable having this makes a lot of sense.

This could also be used to implement very interesting stats just with JavaScript.
fields.summary: Provide REST API for running SQL queries directly on the database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36045].
  {panel}

This bug/feature prevents us from properly maintaining JIRA instances.

This is needed in order to be able to query existing fields and to find out which one of them is broken.

On any big JIRA deployment administrators need to be able to detect and fix broken JQL filters, any change made to the custom fields can break them and you need to be able to detect the affected ones.

By providing this functionality you would allow people to implement this maintenance scripts.

Currently admins are able to browse the filters in the UI, but that kind of maintenance does not allow them to test and doesn't scale for more than very-small jira instances.
fields.summary: Allow retrieval of all saved filters using REST api
Ability to Push Announcement Banner of JIRA to other Integrated Atlassian Application

fields.description:
NullPointerException  is thrown at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.migration.DraftWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper line 148 when the the helper is used in "synchronious" mode as the taskContext variable is only initialized when migrateAsync method is called.

This makes the helper usable only through the migrateAsync method when a workflow scheme being changed is used by only 1 project.
fields.summary: NullPointerException in DraftWorkflowSchemeMigrationHelper when doing migration for a single project

fields.description:
Testing against: Atlassian JIRA (v6.0.8#6109-sha1:57cf099)

Scenario:
- "ProjectA" completed and needs to be archived.
- "ArchiveProject" contains all issues from completed projects.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use the Tools->Bulk Change-All Issues option to move all issues within "ProjectA" to the "ArchiveProject."
2. Confirm that Version/s and Component field values are moved into the Archive Project.
 
Actual Results:
Following the move, each issue's Version/s and Components field values in the ArchiveProject do not reflect their original values.
Current inefficient workaround is to manually add Version/s and Components values from ProjectA to the ArchiveProject before moving the issues.

Expected Results:
An option should exist to allow users to move the Version/s and Components field values from ProjectA to ArchiveProject.
fields.summary: Version/s and Components field values not migrated during move from one project to another.
JIRA Mobile should return a more informative error when locked and re-indexing

fields.description:
This bug regards the new issue navigator plugin. 

1. A custom code calls {{IssueModule.refreshIssue()}} and hooks to the {{Promise}} it returns (e.g., via {{always}}.)
2. Before the resulting AJAX call is done, {{IssueModule.refreshIssue()}} is called another time (it's not the only possibility that can lead to a problem --- see below.)

Expected behaviour: the hook is eventually called.
Observed behaviour: the hook is never called.

h3. What happens

The normal flow of events:

# {{IssueModule.refreshIssue()}} is called, it constructs a {{Deferred}} object and returns its promise. 
# It then calls {{ViewIssueController._update()}} and puts into arguments the callbacks that resolve/reject the {{refreshIssue}}'s deferred.
# {{ViewIssueController._update()}} fetches the issue from the server and adds the fetching deferred to {{this.updating}} (a {{RecurringPromise}}), which subscribes to the fetching-deferred.
# {{ViewIssueController}} is subscribed to {{this.updating}}, so that once the fetching deferred is finished, {{this.updating}} calls {{ViewIssueController._handleLoadSuccess}} or {{ViewIssueController._handleLoadError}}.
# {{ViewIssueController._handleLoad.*}} extract the {{refreshIssue}}'s callbacks from the arguments and call them, so that now anyone who has subscribed to {{IssueModule.refreshIssue()}} gets notified.

The critical part in this flow is for {{ViewIssueController.updating}} (a {{RecurringPromise}}) to call its callbacks with the right arguments --- they should contain the callbacks that notify {{IssueModule.refreshIssue}}'s promise listeners.

But if in the meanwhile someone adds another deferred to {{ViewIssueController.updating}}, the following happens:
* the pending deferred in {{ViewIssueController}} is aborted --- by rejecting the current wrapper deferred (which is unused in the existing scheme) and trying to call {{abort}} on the original promise (which it doesn't have in this case); 
* when the original fetch-deferred finishes, {{ViewIssueController.updating}}'s callbacks are not notified, because the deferred that has triggered the event is not the current one (the current one being the second fetch-deferred.) 

So, the finished event is lost. Note that it can happen if a concurrent request to {{IssueModule.refreshIssue}} is made --- by some other plugin, for example --- or if {{ViewIssueController.updating}} is updated by an issue load event. 

From my point of view, the problem is that {{RecurrentPromise.add()}} incorrectly handles aborting the existing pending deferred. Apparenty, it should notify its {{fail}} and {{always}} callbacks, specifying the "right" arguments; for that, {{RecurrentPromise.add}} should accept not only the new promise, but the arguments that will be passed to the callbacks once this promise becomes aborted. 

This is a major bug because it makes {{IssueModule.refresh}} result quite unusable.
fields.summary: Promise returned by IssueModule.refreshIssue() never finishes in some situations

we plan to upgrade one of our Jiras on Thursday and are doing upgrade testing step by step, but we encountered this issue.

  {panel}

There should be added following functionality in integrity checker:
# Check username integrity
#* Check username integrity in Worklogs
#* Check username integrity in Changehistories
#* ???
# Check duplicate entries
#* Check duplicate entries in ColumnsLayouts
#* Check duplicate entries in UserHistoryItems
#* ???
# Check issuelink integrity
#* Check dead issuelinks, e.g. subtask issues that are not accessible due failed issue move action (when issue have subtasks, and it moved to another project with different WF Scheme)

Duplicates described in items 1, 2 is resulted by migrating JIRA from 4.3.4 to 5.2.4.1
Functionality described in item 3 is needed in case user met not resolved Atlassian known bug [JRA-31734|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31734]
fields.summary: Incorporate Additional Checks to the Integrity Checker

fields.description:
The 'Attach Screenshot' action fails with the following error:
ClassNotFoundException com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreeshotApplet.class
The workaround is to take a screenshot using your operating system's usual method and then upload the resulting file using JIRA's 'Attach file' action.

Installing Java 6 on Chrome is not impossible as you are forced to install Java 7 and Java 6 is no longer being supported by Oracle. (Workaround described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=300811108 does not work)
fields.summary: Attaching screenshot throws ClassNotFoundException com.atlassian.jira.screenshot.applet.ScreenshotApplet.class

fields.description:
Today found a problem on the demo version of Jira.
When creating a user in Russian. User created.
By clicking on the user writes:
"User does not exist, please select a user from the user's browser."
Edit it and so we can not delete.
Database created:
CREATE DATABASE jira CHARSET utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci;
This problem i see only https protocol. On http all worked!
Please help me

/opt/atlassian/jira/conf/server.xml
after 
  <Connector port="8080"
                   
                   maxThreads="150"
                   minSpareThreads="25"
                   connectionTimeout="20000"
                   enableLookups="false"
                   maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   protocol="HTTP/1.1"
                   useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
                   redirectPort="8443"
                   acceptCount="100"
                   disableUploadTimeout="true"/>
i'm add
<Connector port="8443" protocol="HTTP/1.1" SSLEnabled="true"
maxThreads="150" scheme="https" secure="true"
clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS"
keystoreFile="/opt/atlassian/jira/keystore/.keystore" keystorePass="testtest"
/>

/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/web.xml

    <!-- Filters -->

         THIS MUST BE THE FIRST FILTER IN THE DEFINED CHAIN

genkey
./keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA -keystore /opt/atlassian/jira/keystore/.keystore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36009].
  {panel}

Hello!

As you know jira used by many company for external usage.
In this case it can't buy licenses in you rules.

Case of small company like our:
10 developers
10 IT supporerts
5 Managers (directors)
100 small company (it support and small develompent like web) + 10-30 employers in it.

In this case we need to buy about 250 licenses (+250 Agile and +250 Service Desc), but it is imposible for our size company.

But if you split license types for:
1. By users
2. By developers/administrators
 
You can get new sale cake where company have many external users and small internal employers!

For example we buy:
1. 25 Jira Adm/Dev licenes * 100$
2. 10 Jira Agile Adm/Dev licenes  for developers * 100$
3. 10 Jira Service Desc licenes for it support * 100$
+ have ulimited client users

You can get 4500$ and we can pay it. Its normal price for this great system.

If we must pay for every client user... it's imposible :(((
Please think about it.

Best regals, Badalyan Vyacheslav
fields.summary: Other license type

fields.description:
We have many projects in our JIRA instance.
All use Component/s to describe sub-systems of the projects. 
So far, so good...
As many projects are kind of similar in structure, they have the same Component/s names.

My problem is that if I have a pie-chart gadget reporting on several projects issues, and I select the Component/s field as the Statistic type, then each Component is considered as unique even if it is used in all projects.

For ex:
ProjectA - Component/s Comp1, Comp2
ProjectB - Component/s Comp1, Comp3

Suppose I have 3 issues with Comp1 on projectA, 5 issues Comp2/projectB, 6 issues Comp1/projectB, 2 issues Comp3/projectB

Suppose I define my query: 
{code}project in (projectA, projectB){code}

Then I create a pie-chart gadget using this query.
I end up with statistics where it gives:

Comp1 - 3 issues
Comp1 - 6 issues
Comp2 - 5 issues
Comp3 - 2 issues

I would rather have a cumulative on Component/s that have the same name, that is:

Comp1 - 9 issues
Comp2 - 5 issues
Comp3 - 2 issues
fields.summary: Pie-chart gadget does not cumulate issues on Components that have same name across different projects
Gadget Calendar starts on Sunday
Autowatch preference for specific project
Add support to copy / duplicate existing gadget with all configured fields

Currently our [Installing JIRA on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux#InstallingJIRAonLinux-PerforminganUnattendedInstallation] docs contain info on how to use the file however not the structure of it. Can you please add some information about the breakdown of the files? For example what this stuff means:

{noformat}
backupJira$Boolean=true
executeLauncherAction$Boolean=true
app.install.service$Boolean=false
existingInstallationDir=/srv/jira/app

sys.languageId=en

{noformat}

TYVM. :)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-36000].
  {panel}

Please consider using fluid layouts for all JIRA and related product documentation.
This will ensure that regardless of how large the font needs to be in order for your user to read the doc, no side to side scrolling of the pages will be required. The current Fixed layout forces me to scroll my browser page side to side to read documentation topics when I increase font size to a comfortable reading level.

By 'fluid' layout, I'm referring to something like this:
http://opentype.info/blog/2012/07/05/webtext-100-percent-width/
Note the behaviour of the text as the font size is increased. I never have to scroll the page side to side.
fields.summary: Fluid layouts for Atlassian documentation
As an Atlassian Connect developer, I would like to see the Remote IP from a login event webhook
Needs Attention Field
Add the ability to not synchronize email from LDAP using an LDAP user

fields.description:
Whenever I create a new application link from my JIRA instance to another application, such as Confluence, Stash, etc., I'm seeing new items added to the Application Navigator menu in JIRA, having flowed through that application link.  This might be ok, except in several cases I already had those links configured in the JIRA instance, and they now show up more than once.

In other words, the automatic adding of Application Navigator menu items is not very intelligent...at the very least, it shouldn't add duplicate entries.  Ideally, there would be some way of configuring how the Navigator menu items flow through these links.

I'm sure this problem affects more than just JIRA, but I'm seeing it most often in JIRA.  I'm pretty sure it affects Confluence as well.  Also, I've listed 6.0.8 as the Affects Version only because that's my current version.  Again, I'm sure more versions are actually affected.
fields.summary: Duplicate items added to Application Navigator menu through application links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35995].
  {panel}

The "JIRA Configuration Tool" should support JNDI.

Currently....

{noformat}
[marks@jira-dev bin]$ bash config.sh
Loading application properties from /usr/local/...
Reading database configuration from /usr/local/jira/dbconfig.xml
IO Exception occurred while trying to load settings.
You current database configuration uses JNDI, and this configuration tool does not support that
X connection to localhost:10.0 broken (explicit kill or server shutdown).
{noformat}

(Yes...  that does say "You current..")

JIRA Component = "Config Tool".
fields.summary: JIRA Configuration Tool Support for JNDI

fields.description:
I'm getting above error from last couple of days. I have tried few things like 
1. Upgrading java to 1.0.7.
2. Increased execution time in bin/setnev.sh (Datlassian.pluginsenable.wait=300)
3. Cleared Cache files in a installed plugin directory/working directory (now it didn't recreated it- another issue)
4. Catalina folder content clear.
 
Also I'm using evaluation period license on standalone with Ubuntu 12 with vmware.

Thanks


The following plugins are required by JIRA, but have not been started:

    Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Project Config Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-project-config-plugin)
    Embedded Gadgets Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded)
    Gadget Dashboard Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard)
    Opensocial Plugin (com.atlassian.gadgets.opensocial)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35988].
  {panel}

Prior to the version 6.1, JIRA will remove the user (delete) when the user is removed from LDAP. However, due to the the improvement request JRA-24937 implement at 6.1 onwards. The user is being changed to inactive when the user have login attribute before rather than being deleted.

*Note:* User that is created by not login before will be removed, only affects user that have not login before.

The use case of the customer:
{quote}
Duplicating this is very simple simply find existing user ( which may or may not be double registered as in the same email appears twice but under two different usernames )

Move all issues belonging to that user to another user.

Delete that user from ad/ldap and notices that the user still exist after removal but flagged inactive.

In the attached pictures you will see a user that our helpdesk incorrectly registered twice under two different companies but with the same email address.

Now moving all the issues to the correct username under the correct company and deleting the user from ldap, jira still shows the delete user as "inactive" thus encounter permissions error since the user email address is still seen twice.
{quote}

So customer would like to have the feature to disable this feature to flag the user to inactive and delete them off JIRA after sync. Exactly like how the usual way prior to 6.1 works.
fields.summary: Add Ability To Configure Users to be Removed from JIRA after being Removed from LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35987].
  {panel}

Dear Support,

Can I ask for nice feature via which users will be able to opt for email subscription as per their requirements?

Now we can either enable notifications or disable. If we enable we can enable it for list of users or few roles like reporter/assignee etc.

But we would like to limit it on user's choice. e.g. if we select reporter to be notified then then every reporter will be notified. Some people feel that its a spam for them. So is it possible to implement notifications subscription feature to be available near future or is there any plan to implement it?
fields.summary: Ability to opt for the notifications from Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35985].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Follow the wizard and create a new custom field with checkboxes. Its required that at least one be added. I created yes/no values. 
# Associate said field to the default screen 
# Make the field required (Field Configuration screen)
# Remove the pre-defined options from step 1 (custom fields > configure)
# Create an issue under any project and you'll see the red banner saying the field is mandatory. 

Ideally we can prevent the custom fields options from being NULL so if a person deletes the options, you should not be able to save the changes.
fields.summary: Cannot Create Issues After Deleting All Custom field options for a mandatory field
Clone link terminology

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35983].
  {panel}

Unable to import the same field from a CSV file to two different field in JIRA.

Why? There is a very good use-case for this: Considering that the "Summary" field is required, you may want to import some other field inside the summary but at the same time you still need to keep this field at this proper place.

Now, if you select one field for one mapping Jira will not let you configure the same field again.

Clearly the current behavior was more life a "feature", but not quite an useful one.
fields.summary: Unable to import the same field from a CSV file to two different field in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35982].
  {panel}

If you try to import CSV, after you press import CSV will create records or throw errors for each parsing error.

Currently there is no option to preview / validate the data, meaning that you cannot really run import on production because it will mess the database almost for sure and even when you run it on a test instance you do have to do a LOT of bulk removal in order to remove the partial imports.

So far do I not see any reliable way to import many issues from CSV.

The desired behavior would be one that would show you the errors, allowing you to re-upload the files and "preview" the import again, so you will perform the operation only when all the data is sanitized.
fields.summary: Ability to preview / cancel a CSV Import

fields.description:
CSV Import fails to import data if a header contain "+" plus sign.

This should not happen.
fields.summary: CSV Import fails to import data if a header contain "+" plus sign

fields.description:
If you export a currency field from Excel to CSV you will get a record with a text like:
{code} 
" 5,790.14 "
"$ 5,790.14 "
"5,790.14 USD"
" (3,283.78)"
"56.71%"
" .2,431.70 ", 
(45.00) 
{code}

All the values presented above are not recognized as number even if they should.

The algorithm for converting them to numbers is not so complex, it requires removal of all characters that are not digits, decimal-dot (configurable), percent or (). If () are present the number will be negative and you can remove them. If percent is present you will remove it and divide the recognized number by 100. "10%" is always considered to be "0.1" float.

The idea is to call atof() only on something that was sanitized first.
fields.summary: CSV Import does fail to recognize different number formats including currency ones

fields.description:
Date import should be able to import both date and datetime values.

Specifying something like this for the format should allow you to import both types of data: "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm"

Jira should expect to find only YYYY-MM-DD for dates and the full version for date-time fields.
fields.summary: CSV import cannot import datetimes

fields.description:
On CSV Import Status field is missing from mappings, making impossible to import Status

While the documentation states that it is possible to import the Status, we discovered that this field is just missing and Jira always imports all records with default Status.
fields.summary: On CSV Import Status field is missing from mappings, making impossible to import Status

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Test Project A
# Create a component  in Test Project and assigned to User A.
# Ensure Outgoing Mail Server configured and working
# Create a Notification Scheme
# Under *Issue Deleted Event*, set to User B and Component Lead
# Associate the Notification Scheme to Project A
# Create a Test issue with component.
# Delete the Test issue

h4. Expected Result

Both User A(Component Lead) and User B receive the notifications.

h4. Actual Result.

Only User B receive the notification

h4. Note:
Most of the system event triggered notifications to Component Lead except Issue Deleted Event.
fields.summary: Issue Deleted Event Notification is not sending to Component Lead

fields.description:
On the System Dashboard, the Activity Stream has no 'edit' option when clicking the drop down triangle. The only options are Minimise and Refresh. 

Hitting the Maximise button, works as expected, but then the 'edit' option is available using the drop down triangle. Selecting 'edit' takes one to the edit screen where filters and number of issues can be set, and then save selected. None of these edits are actually saved. 

The only way I was able to edit the Activity Stream permanently was through the Administration  -- System -- User Interface -- System Dashboard and then selecting the drop down triangle on the Activity Stream box, and then edit. 

I am guessing that offering edit on the triangle drop down in the maximised version of the Activity Stream is simply an oversight, but it certainly cost me some time in realising why all my edits were not being saved.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Maximised Activity Stream in System Dashboard does not Work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35964].
  {panel}

If compat mode is forced upon someone using IE/8/9/10/11 they receive a message saying:
"Internet Explorer 6.0*(or 7.0)* is not a supported browser, and some features may not have full functionality. See _Supported Platforms_  for more information."

Suggest changing to:
"You are using an unsupported browser or your browser might be in the Compatibility View mode. See _Supported Platforms_  for more information."
fields.summary: Unsupported browser message not helpful when in Compat Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35961].
  {panel}

I receive a ton of email daily from the very productive teams that I work with.  I love both JIRA and Crucible Mentions, however they are really lacking a sound way to be marked as important by Outlook rules.

*JIRA when I am not a member that receives every email in the project:*

I have a rule based on the subject "mentioned you (JIRA)"

This is the best case of the four. Because the signal to noise ratio is perfect.

*JIRA when I am a member that receives every email for the project:*

The only thing that stands out that I was mentioned is that my name "Last,First" is in the text of the email.  However when using this to trigger Oulook alerts there are many false positives (e.g. when I am the default assignee for many components).

*Crucible when I was assigned on the review already:*

Every email has my name in the list at the bottom of the email in the participant list, so my trick with JIRA of searching the text of the email for "Last,First" will be a full reversal of Signal to Noise ratio.

*Crucible when I have not been assigned on the review:*

I have a rule based on "mentioned you in the review" being in the subject. Similar to JIRA this works very well. 

*Proposal:*

In all cases simply list in the email (similar to how all Crucible Participants are listed at the bottom):
{noformat}
Mentioned: Last1,First1
Mentioned: Last2,First2
{noformat}

This will make it simple for any user to re-route the emails where he/she is mentioned to a folder where she can give special attention with a very straight forward Outlook rule.  The information is in the system already so should not be a strain on the system, this is merely asking for a change in the representation of the information.

Possibly related to: JRA-27798, JRA-27315, JRA-32401
Current Jira Version at my company: v5.2.5#847-sha1:7fd7dd6
Current Crucible Version at my company: Version:3.0.2 Build:20130702014905 2013-07-02
fields.summary: Mention Emails Play Nice with Outlook Rules

Difference being the upper/lower case within the issue key

Feature or bug, who knows, but it was unexpected for me at least. I'm using Chrome.

fields.description:
*Problem*

If you have users members of a group with a different DN casing, JIRA will not get the group membership successfully.

For example a group with the following members results in a situation where user1 is successfully synchronized but user2 doesn't
{noformat}
memberUid: uid=jpouche,ou=users,dc=netprospex,dc=com
memberUid: uid=adrane,ou=Users,dc=netprospex,dc=com
{noformat}
* Notice the capital "U" in "Users" for the second entry

*Workaround*
The workaround at the moment is to set the DN "correctly" in the group attributes in LDAP.
fields.summary: Case Sensitive DN causes users to not get group membership correctly

  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* Select Tools -> Bulk Change
* Select some of the issues to perform a bulk change (step 1)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35954].
  {panel}

Hello,

While testing for 508 compliance for the Application Life Cycle Management / Mobile Carwash project, it was found that JIRA is not in compliance with the Federal Government 508/ Accessibility policies. Below are instances where such compliance is lacking. This purpose of this ticket is to bring these issues to your attention in the hopes that they are addressed or there is a remediation plan in place.

Please see details below. We have also included a Best Practice Recommendation for each issue and the reasons a fix should be implemented. Also, issue snapshots can be accessed through the attached PDF. Thank you!

*Date Tested:* 11/05/13
*Point of Contact:* Doug Hansen; Phone: 202-447-0790; Email: Doug.Hansen@hq.dhs.gov
*DHS Component:* OCIO/MGMT/ESDO
*Project Name:* Application Life Cycle Management / Mobile Carwash
*Project Description:* Provide a streamlined testing platform to mobile applications development teams within the Federal Government
*Product Name & Version:* Atlassian JIRA 6.1

508 ISSUES:
NOTE: See attached PDF for screen shots of each documented 508 Accessibility issue.

*1).    21(a); 21(c) 1.1 Keyboard Access* 
A.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Cannot access first menu via keyboard
 
B.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Some applet icons are not keyboard accessible
 
C.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Keyboard shortcuts help screen is not keyboard scrollable
 
D.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Credits page: cannot access names via keyboard
 
E.	An interactive element or function cannot be accessed or activated by keyboard. 
Example: Cannot access Configure Fields via keyboard
 
F.	At any time, there is no visual indication of the current focus (loss of focus). 
Example: Visible focus lost in several places, e.g. after Tools menu

Best Practice Recommendation: Make all icons, images, fields, and interactive elements and functions accessible via keyboard.
\\
\\ \\ 
*2)      B08 3.1 Color Dependence*
A.   In software, information is provided only by color. 
Example: Toggle control shows which is selected by use of color only

Best Practice Recommendation: Provide information via other means beside color
\\
\\ \\ 
*3).     22(a) B07 2.2 Web: Images*
A.   A Web image does not have an ALT, TITLE or ARIA attribute. 
Example: Some images (e.g. photo placeholder) are missing ALT/TITLE
 
Best Practice Recommendation: Include ALT, TITLE or ARIA attribute
\\
\\ \\ 
*4).  22(d) B22 11 Web: Style sheet Dependence*	
A. Programming code or other confusing elements are revealed on the page. 
Example: Code is displayed when CSS is disabled
 
B.	Programming code or other confusing elements are revealed on the page. 
Example: Unidentified elements (e.g. unlabeled button) are revealed
 
Best Practice Recommendation: Remove confusing elements revealed on page
\\
\\ \\ 
*5).	22(g) B13 10 Web: Data Tables*
A. Any data table's row or column headers are not identified programmatically. 
Example: Tables are missing SCOPE markup
 
B. Any data table's row or column headers are not identified programmatically. 
Example: Calendar is missing SCOPE=col

Best Practice Recommendation:  Identify a table’s row/column programmatically.
\\
\\ \\ 
*6).	22i B23 12 Web: Frames*
A. An iframe's Title or Name is non-descriptive. 
Example: iframe names are not descriptive of content

Best Practice Recommendation: Include description on iframe.
\\
\\ \\ 
*7).      22(l), 31(a), 31(b) B161.2.3 Web: Links and User Controls*	
A. A scripted element does not have a unique and meaningful description. 
Example: Javascript elements are missing description

Best Practice Recommendation: Include description on scripted elements
\\
\\ \\ 
*8). 22n B11 1.2.2 Web: Forms* 
A. A Web form field has no markup to associate it to its complete instructions and cues. 
Example: Some form fields do not have associative markup (e.g. Search Filters)
 
B. A Web form field has no markup to associate it to its complete instructions and cues. 
Example: Some instructions are not associated with their input fields
 
C. A Web form field has no markup to associate it to its complete instructions and cues. 
Example: Error messages are not associated with their input fields
 
Best practices recommendation: Include associated markup with web forms
\\
\\ \\ 
*9).  22(o) B05 13 Web: Repetitive Content and Links*
A. There is no method to skip repetitive content. 
Example: No skip method provided

Best Practice Recommendation: Include a method to skip repetitive content
\\
\\ \\ 
*10). 22(p)B25 7 Time Outs*	
A. The application timed out without notification. 
Example: No notification given

B. The application timed out without an option to request more time. 
Example: No notification given

Best Practice Recommendation: Add notification for users before application timeouts
\\
\\ \\ 
*11). 31(a), 31(b) B16 1.2.3 Web: Links and User Controls*
A. A link does not have a unique and meaningful description. 
Example: "More" links and "Type …" links
 
B. A link does not have a unique and meaningful description. 
Example: Some links are not uniquely identified
 	
Best Practice Recommendation: Add unique and detailed descriptions to links
\\
\\ \\ 
*12). 31(a), 31(b) B17 9.1 Web: Language*
A. The correct default language for the page is not programmatically set. 
Example: Not specified
	
Best Practice Recommendation: Programmatically set the default language
\\
\\ \\ 
*13). 31(b) B09 3.2 Color Contrast*
A. The contrast ratio is less than 4.5:1 for content background and foreground colors. 
Example: Gray dropdown arrows (3.81:1)
 
B. The contrast ratio is less than 4.5:1 for content background and foreground colors. 
Example: Selected menu (4.16:1)
 
C. The contrast ratio is less than 4.5:1 for content background and foreground colors. 
Example: Grey text (2.61:1)
 
D. The contrast ratio is less than 4.5:1 for content background and foreground colors. 
Example: Footer text (4.27:1)
 
Best Practice Recommendation: Increase contrast ratio to 4.5:1 for content background and foreground colors
fields.summary: JIRA 508 Accessibility Issues

fields.description:
How to reproduce ...

*Configuration*
* A Transition Screen with Assignee and Affect Version fields
* In Field Configuration, set Affect Version has mandatory

*Scenario*
* For an issue assigned to User 1 (Id=user1, Name="User 1") 
* Initiate the Transition
* Select a new Assignee : User 2 (Id=user2, Name="User 2") 
* Let Affect Version not selected
* Validate the transition
* Validation fails due to missing *Affect Version* with :
** Error message displayed for *Affect Version* field
** The Assignee field has not error, and the value *user2* is displayed
* Select the Affect Version in order to respect Field constraint
* Validate the Transition
* The Transition is accepted but the passed assignee value is *user1*

Bug identified on JIRA 5.1.5 and reproduce with 6.1 (on fresh instance).
fields.summary: Displayed User Field value not saved after a Validation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35948].
  {panel}

The behavior of the "Create another" feature should be enhanced to be more generally useful.  You have started to make decisions for the customers regarding which fields are more important than others to be filled out and therefore reset to default upon using the "Create another" checkbox.  This needs to be addressed so this feature is enhanced to be useful for all customers.

Possibilities include:
# Reset ALL fields to field configuration defaults upon using the "Create another" checkbox.
** The reason for this is that you have decided that fields such as Summary, Description, and Time Tracking fields should be cleared due to the importance of populating these fields correctly for the new issue being created.  However, you have forgotten about all the extremely important custom fields that customers will create, or other fields such as Affects Version or Fix Version that some customers may find more important to change than Description or Time Tracking.  Therefore, you should just clear out all fields which will force users to re-address all fields and fill them out accordingly.
# Provide a second checkbox after selecting "Create another" called something like "Persist all fields" which will toggle between clearing all fields to default, and copying all fields to the new issue create screen.
** This will provide the users a little flexibility in how they would like their "Create another" checkbox to behave and therefore make it useful for a larger audience.
# Default ALL fields to being persisted between issue creates when using the "Create another" checkbox, however have an administrative section under Fields for exclusions to the persistence.
** This way, customers can specify the fields that they want to have cleared when using the "Create another" checkbox thus giving them a way to specify which fields they think are the most important fields (including custom fields) and should be cleared between issue creates.

Please Vote for this issue.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Enhance Field Persistance features between issue creates when using "Create another" checkbox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35946].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA is using 128-bit encryption when it is running over SSL:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS

Current known workaround:
* use SSL in front of Apache Webserver or Nginx

h3. Workaround

Our [Default SSL ciphers too weak|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Security+tools+report+the+default+SSL+Ciphers+are+too+weak] KB covers this in further detail.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA to have option to enforce 256-bit encryption or higher
During the CSV import process, the link to SimpleDateFormat documentation is broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35943].
  {panel}

It would be great if i could "lock" jira instance so that only admins have access to the instance. So if i update jira to a new version i wouldn't have to restrict access to jira via firewall.

This function exists already for indexing so i guess it could be easily implemented. For non admin users there could be a page with an editable text or hint.

Benefits:
* admins can take down jira for maintenance and still work with it
* users know that there is maintenance going on and they don't bother admins 
* admins don't have to change network setting
* maybe export/import feature could be working properly because nobody can be locked in

Regards
Robert
fields.summary: Lock JIRA for Non-Admin Accounts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35937].
  {panel}

h4. Diagnosis
Importing project from one JIRA + JIRA Agile instance with English (United States) to a new instance JIRA + JIRA Agile instance on English (UK)

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Create backup on one instance using English (United States) language
# Start a new instance on English (UK) language
# Run project import onto the new instance

h4. Error message
{code:title=atlassian-jira.log}
2013-11-25 09:28:23,298 JiraTaskExectionThread-6 ERROR admin 568x816x1 1m076so 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSelectProject.jspa [jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService] The custom field 'Epic Color' of type 'Colour of Epic' is required for the import but does not exist in the current JIRA instance.
{code}

!project import.png|thumbnail!

h4. Cause of error
The difference of letter *'u'* in Epic Color and Epic Colour causes JIRA to think that there are 2 different custom fields. 

h4. Workaround
Rename the custom field manually. Refer to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=425462621] guide.
(i) If the custom field is locked, unlock it first using the guide here - [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
fields.summary: Project Import fails with "custom field xxx of type xxx is required for the import but does not exist"
User Management: Turn off e-mail notification per user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for particular strings in JIRA, Lucene does not seem to recognise them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the following to an issue:
{noformat}
CSS: /Volumes/eCommerce/datlassian.com/launches/36_HOL13_DEC/cc_b_landing/delivery/2/munchkin.css 
JS: /Volumes/eCommerce/datlassian.com/launches/36_HOL13_DEC/cc_b_landing/delivery/2/munchkin.js
{noformat}
# Search for that issue using munchkin:
{noformat}
text ~ munchkin
{noformat}

Additional steps to reproduce:

# Create 2 issues.
# Add the following descriptions, one to each issue:
{code}
[Ver_munchkin_Korean_Seoul_2017.xlsm]
[Ver4_munchkin_Korean_Seoul_2017.xlsm]
{code}
# Search for the below:
{noformat}
text ~ munchkin
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The issue is returned, or both issues are returned.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is not returned, or only one issue is returned ({{[Ver_munchkin_Korean_Seoul_2017.xlsm]}}).

h3. Notes

Adding munchkin as a comment and searching again will return the issue.
fields.summary: Certain issues are not returned by JIRA searches due to complicated strings

fields.description:
Connection test failed.  Response from server:

fields.summary: Clone direction still broken

fields.description:
Hello,

I created a global transition on a workflow. (the 'Cancel' one) I made sure to create it last so it would have the highest ID and so be displayed last in the Workflow dropdown list.

Although this 'Cancel' transition has the highest ID, is displayed last when I have a look at the workflow, this 'Cancel' transition button is displayed first.

Can you tell me when this will be fixed and if there is a workaround I could use.

Thanks,

(I tried to set the opsbar-sequence to 9999 but it doesn't make any difference, I didn't set any opsbar-sequence to the other transitions but it would take a significant amount of time and make maintenance much harder, I chose to create a global transition to save time and make maintenance easier so please, take this into account when offering a workaround :-) )
fields.summary: Global transition button displayed in the wrong order

fields.description:
The HTML email notifications that JIRA provides when tickets are updated/modified/commented on do not specify the actual text colour for what is expected to be black.

This is okay on most systems/email viewers where the system text colour defaults to black, but if you are using a high contrast or inverted colour scheme in windows the text that should be black shows up as the system text colour which can be white (or nearly so).

Explicitly setting a text colour is always recommended when explicitly setting a background colour.
fields.summary: JIRA emails do not specify default text colour
Upgrade JIRA Timesheet Plugin to version 2.6 or later for OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35923].
  {panel}

Currently the Filters slide-out sidebar is not available on a number of pages, e.g issue details or various project, dashboards and configuration pages.

I find myself using filters a lot to navigate JIRA and I have to go to the Issues drop down menu way too often.

It is quite convenient to simply move the mouse to the left of the screen and get my filters. This should be possible wherever one is inside the system.

At least make that an option for users to set in the configuration, please.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Make the Filters sidebar available on all screens
